column3:
I am very hungry. I look for my mother.
ewline
ewlineWhen is dinner? I ask.
ewline
ewlineDinner is at six, my mother says.
ewline
ewlineWhat can we eat? I ask.
ewline
ewlineWe can pick food from our garden, she says. I help her pick corn, beans, and peas.
ewline
ewlineThe corn is yellow and white. The beans are small and brown. The peas are green and round.
ewline
ewlineI put the beans in a basket. I put the peas in a bowl. Mother brings the corn. We go inside.
ewline
ewlineI have dirty hands. I wash my hands with soap and water. The water is warm. My hands are now clean.
ewline
ewlineMother lets me stir the beans. I fill a pot with water. Mother puts the corn into the pot. She puts the pot on the stove. The water boils.
ewline
ewlineMary is my sister. Mary puts four plates on the table. Each plate is blue.
ewline
ewlineWe each eat two pieces of meat. I eat more corn than Mary. Mary eats more beans than our mother.
ewline
ewlineWhat did you learn today? Mary asks.
ewline
ewlineI can spell ten new words, I say.
ewline
ewlineMary can only spell two words.
column4: one: What color are our plates?
column9: multiple: Which food was not eaten at dinner?
column14: multiple: In which way did I not help my mother?
column19: one: How many words can Mary spell?
